answers.answer: Hello,depends what tests you had.Fasting blood sugar can be high in diabetes, but not always.  To be truely normal you would want to see fasting blood sugar below 95 (and ideally in the 80s).Another test is HBA1C.  Truely normal HBA1c should be less than 5.0.5.0 - 6.0 is prediabetic and above 6 is already a concern.To prevent diabetes maintain normal weight, limit carbs, and exercise daily.Hope this helps.

"Iv never been tested for diabetes, but my dad has type 2."Call and ask your doctor what test were included in the "routine blood test." Diabetes testing should be part of your annual examination especially with family history.

question: Hi, I had a routine blood test done, everything was normal. I was just wondering id I had Diabetes, would there be signs of it in my routine blood test?? Like would my blood sugar levels show a problem? Iv never been tested for diabetes, but my dad has type 2.
title: Not worried, just want to know
